did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, memoranda, minutes, and printed matter relating to Weigel's role as a theologian and scholar, the role of religion, specifically from the Christian and Catholic point of view, in American foreign policy, peace and disarmament movements, and activities of the World without War Council and the Ethics and Public Policy Center..

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], George Weigel papers, [Box number], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 2010.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note

chronitem.event: Born, Baltimore Maryland
B.A. (magna cum laude), St. Mary's Seminary and University, Baltimore, MD
Lecturer in theology, Christian Brothers College, Orangeville, Ontario
M.A. (summa cum laude), University of St. Michael's College, Toronto, Ontario
Assistant professor of theology and assistant dean of studies, St. Thomas Seminary, Washington, DC
Instructor in religion and pastoral theology, Religious Education Center, Seattle, WA
Scholar in residence, World without War Council of Greater Seattle, Seattle
Founder and director of Cathedral Fellowships in World Affairs
Member of executive committee, Institute on Religion and Democracy

eventgrp.event: Member of Board of Regents, Seattle University
Co-director of American Initiatives Project, World without War Council

chronitem.event: Member of advisory committee on ethical values, U.S. Information Agency
Member of board of directors, Rural Development Institute
Mars Lecturer on theology, ethics, war, and peace, Northwestern University
Research fellow at Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars
President, James Madison Foundation, Washington, DC
Associate, Center on Religion and Society
Member, Keston-USA; Member, Puebla Institute
Member, Ad Hoc Committee on Religious Liberty; Editor and principal author, American Purpose; Co-director, U.S. Institute of Peace Seminar
President, Ethics and Public Policy Center, Washington, DC
Senior fellow, Ethics and Public Policy Center
Director of the Catholic Studies program, Ethics and Public Policy Center
Author, The Cube and the Cathedral: Europe, America, and Politics without God, Basic Books (New York, NY)
Distinguished senior fellow, Ethics and Public Policy Center

bioghist.p: "George Weigel." Contemporary Authors Online. Detroit: Gale, 2009. Gale Biography In Context. Web. 24 Sept. 2010
George Weigel. n.d. Web. http://georgeweigel.blogspot.com/ 24 Sept. 2010
"The Syndicated Column of George Weigel: The Catholic Difference." Denver Catholic Register: The Archdiocese of Denver, 2010. http://www.archden.org/index.cfm/ID/342. Web. 24 Sept. 2010

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: The papers consist of correspondence, writings, memoranda, minutes, and printed matter relating to Weigel's role as a theologian and scholar, the role of religion, specifically from the Christian and Catholic point of view, in American foreign policy, peace and disarmament movements, and activities of the World without War Council and the Ethics and Public Policy Center.

The bulk of material relates specifically to Weigel's work as a member of the World without War Council, the James Madison Foundation, and the Ethics and Public Policy Center. Extensive documentation is also present regarding Weigel's role in the Millennium Appeal for freedom of religion in the Soviet Union that was sent to Mikhail Gorbachev.
Materials of interest include booklets regarding the role religious leaders can play in world peace and disarmament.

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.
controlaccess.subject: Religion and international affairs.
Peace.
Pacifism.
Disarmament.
controlaccess.corpname: Ethics and Public Policy Center (Washington, D.C.)

scopecontent.p: Consists of correspondence between Weigel and private individuals as well as correspondence with members of related organizations. Arranged alphabetically by name of correspondent.

did.unittitle: Lutheran Church in America/Pacific Northwest Synod,

scopecontent.p: Ambassador, Assistant Secretary of State, Bureau of Human Rights and Humanitarian Affairs, United States Department of State

Contains documents related to organizations and specific projects Weigel was involved in. The bulk of the materials come from Weigel's involvement with the World Without War Council, the Ethics and Public Policy Center, and the Millennium Appeal to Mikhail Gorbachev (1988) for freedom of religion in the Soviet Union. Arranged alphabetically by name of project or organization.

did.unittitle: EPPC Sollicitudo Rei Socialis Conference, March 18, 1988,

scopecontent.p: Includes seminar materials, notes, and related correspondence. Arranged by seminar date
Includes correspondence, newsletters, collected materials and clippings, and other materials related to the foundation and their work with Congressman John Miller

did.unittitle: Weigel's resignation from Congressman Miller's staff and related materials,

scopecontent.p: Consists of materials pertaining to an appeal to Mikhail Gorbachev for freedom of religion in the Soviet Union. Includes correspondence, notes, and related documents
Includes documents in Russian and Ukrainian

did.unittitle: World Without War Council (WWWC) regional projects,

scopecontent.p: Consists of completed forms and related correspondence for those whose signatures appeared on the appeal

did.unittitle: "Assessing Religious Freedom in the Soviet Union: One Year After the Millennium" conference,

scopecontent.p: Includes follow-up information to the Millennium Appeal and other related documents

did.unittitle: National Association of Evangelicals (NAE) and Peace, Freedom, and Security Studies (PFSS) materials,

scopecontent.p: Includes course materials and related documents

did.unittitle: Guidelines on Peace Freedom and Security Studies booklet, critiques, responses, and other information,
WWWC involvement and Bob Pickus correspondence,
Washington World Affairs Fellows (WWAF) records and financial information,
Board of directors meetings and related documents,
Study Guide to Bishops Statement The Challenge of Peace: God's Promise and Our Response,
Other organizations, projects, and collected items,
"Reestablishing and Extending the Idea of the Common Good" project,

scopecontent.p: A joint project between the James Madison Foundation and the WWWC

did.unittitle: Simon, William E. speech at University of Notre Dame,

scopecontent.p: Includes text of speech, related correspondence, and other writings by Simon

Includes materials related to conferences, workshops, seminars and other speaking engagements in which Weigel participated, as well as some of his writings and related materials. Arranged by organization or title.

did.unittitle: American Bar Association (ABA) National Security Workshop, Deception and Deterrence in "Wars of National Liberation," State-Sponsored Terrorism, and Other Forms of Secret Warfare,
ABA workshop, The Vietnam Debate: A Fresh Look at the Arguments,

scopecontent.p: Includes Weigel's article "'Vietnam' and the transformation of the American Catholic Debate on War and Peace"

did.unittitle: "An Appeal for the Religious Freedom in the Soviet Union on the Occasion of the Millennium of Christianity in the Kievan Rus,"

scopecontent.p: Includes drafts and related correspondence

did.unittitle: Arms Control and Disarmament Agency/Strategic Defense Initiative correspondence,
Association of Jesuit Colleges and Universities Campus Ministers,
Carnegie Council on Ethics and International Affairs Seminar,

scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, clippings and information regarding Bishop Armstrong

did.unittitle: Christian College Coalition American Studies Program Seminar,
"Christian Responsibility in an Election Year" at St. Marks Church,
Communion and liberation lecture, Catholic University,
CRS/James Madison Foundation "After the Threat" conference,
"Exorcising Wilson's Ghost: Morality and Foreign Policy in America's Third Century," Washington Quarterly,

scopecontent.p: Includes draft and copy of published version

George Mason University, Nuclear War Education Conference,
Lithuanian Catholic Religious Group and the 100th U.S. Congress,
National Federation of Priests Council Disarmament Resolution,
1979 Northwest Religious Education Congress, Yakima, WA,

University of Washington course "Arms, Citizens and the Shape of the Future,"
